text: Access outer class from inner class in python
I have a situation like so...

code:
class Outer(object):

    def some_method(self):
        # do something

    class Inner(object):
        def __init__(self):
            self.Outer.some_method()    # <-- this is the line in question

text: How can I access the Outer class's method from the Inner class?
I'm concluding that I need to re-assess how I had designed this to be implemented and come up with a more robust method.
